title: # Willkommen beim Dirschbacher Data Lab
text:
Ãœber mich
Ich bin Sozialwissenschaftler*in mit Schwerpunkt Stadt- und Regionalentwicklung und arbeite vor allem mit quantitativen Methoden.
Besonders interessieren mich Themen wie Migration, Wohnen, Ungleichheit und soziale Netzwerke â€“ und wie man sie mit Daten besser versteht.

title: # Willkommen beim Dirschbacher Data Lab
text:

title: Dirschbacher Data Lab
text:
Data analysis & research with R & Python â€“ for NGOs, companies and startups. I support small to medium-sized analysis and research projects â€” from exploratory analyses to clean, fully reproducible reports. â€”


Data Analysis & Reporting - Descriptive analyses, visualizations, dashboards
- Reproducible reports (RMarkdown/Quarto, GitHub)
Research Support - Questionnaire and study design (quantitative)
- Analysis of survey and panel data
- Support for academic theses and research reports
Consulting & Sparring - Methodological consulting (e.g., panel data, fixed effects, mediation)
- Review of existing analyses
- Support with data cleaning & documentation





NGOs & non-profits aiming to make their impact more visible

Companies & startups that want to leverage data but donâ€™t yet have a full data team

Research institutions / projects needing additional analytical capacity





Impact of Housing Conditions on Social Integration among Refugees (Masterâ€™s Thesis)
- Panel data analysis (IAB-BAMF-SOEP Refugee Survey)
- Focus: Relationship between duration of stay in collective housing, language proficiency, and social capital
- Methods: Fixed-effects models, mediation, visualization of time trends
(PDF or summary can be linked here later.)
Example: Exploratory Analysis & Report with R
- Data preparation, visualizations, clear reporting for non-technical audiences
- Reproducible workflow with Git + R




Transparent & reproducible: Code is versioned and documented.

Explained, not just delivered: Results are prepared so they can be shared internally with ease.

Pragmatic: I prefer a clear, robust approach over overly complex models without added value.







R (tidyverse, ggplot2, fixest, broom, â€¦)

Quarto / RMarkdown for reports

Git & GitHub for version control & collaboration

Export to PDF, HTML, Word â€” depending on your needs





I am a social scientist specializing in urban and regional development, working primarily with quantitative methods.
Iâ€™m especially interested in topics such as migration, housing, inequality, and social networks â€” and how data can help us understand them better.




ðŸ“§ EMail: dirschbacher-data-lab@posteo.de
ðŸ”— GitHub: @Svenja161
Feel free to send me a message with a short description of your project â€” Iâ€™m happy to explore how I can support you.
